OFFICE OF
MOGALTHURU-2-
We are brothers of the same birth, that is, you are my brother.
I have the great love I have for you and I have the intention to give you some property free of charge for your future happiness. Therefore, in return for your love, I hereby give you my property free of charge as per the following schedules, relinquishing all my rights and interests in the said property and transferring them all to you. Therefore, from this day forward, you are the full rightful owner of the property in the schedule and you can enjoy it freely and happily, with the right to donate and sell it to your children and grandchildren, as per your wishes, by paying all taxes. Regarding this, I and my people will be able to implement this settlement without any interruption for you, your people and your heirs, regardless of the disputes that may arise between you and me at any time and from whomever. I hereby give you this property settlement document, having fully assured you that there are no other encumbrances or encumbrances on the Scheduled Property till date, that there are no court seizures, injunctions etc. on the Scheduled Property, that no one else has any shareholding rights on the Scheduled Property except me, that the property is uninhabited, the boundaries and the survey number are correct, and that I have written and given you this property settlement document. I hereby file a notice for the registration of the Scheduled Property in your name in the Panchayat accounts. The Scheduled Property is not a property assigned by the Government and given as a D. Patta. Act No.9/77
I am not a bondman. The property in the Schedule below was the property of my ancestral father,
and from that date till today, I have been in full possession of the property.
This deed is accompanied by the payment of stamp duty, registration fee, user charges, etc., vide CFMS Challan dated 28-01-
2026.
- Kodeti Aam JanuluSheet Endorsement

I hereby declare that the property mentioned in the document be-
longs to me and was not alienated earlier and if it is found to have been
violated the provisions of Section 22B of Registration Act, 1908 I would
be liable for penal action as per Section 82 of Registration Act,1908.
Section 22–B Registration Act - 1908
Declaration
This declaration is to inform that in preparing this document, I/We have taken all the necessary documents such as the details of the property in the document, copies of the land title deeds, tax receipts for the land/houses, details of the parties in the link document, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, details of the property etc. and have thoroughly examined all the aspects and have included them in this document and have prepared the document. No matter that should have been written or included has been omitted in this document. The schedule property has been physically examined and measured and the document has been drawn up. I/We declare that the said property has not been sold, transferred, etc. to anyone else except for the sale to you, that this property is an undisputed property, that there are no dues payable on the said property, and that I/We am/are able to pay the depreciation stamp duty found during the inspection of the said property by the authorities (Registration and Stamps Revenue Department). I/We have not violated the provisions of Section 22-B of the Registration Act, 1908. And I/We are fully responsible for all other matters. Neither the Sub-Registrar nor the Registrar of Deeds have any connection with it. We are responsible for any and all claims made in this sale deed by the Government, Endowment, Waks Board and other agencies if it is found that the sale deed is not an assignment and if such a claim is made in the future. This is a declaration that we have read/read this document in full and have given our full consent. Written by
Koda Anjaneyulu

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 391 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Kodeti Anjaneyulu in favour of his brother, Kodeti Sitaram, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 51 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 7-1033, Assessment number 1033 (old) 214284000968 (New), comprised in survey number 18/3, situated in Kuppanapudi Village and Grama Panchayath, Akivedu Mandal, within the District of West Godavari registered at sub-registrar office Mogalthuru is bounded as follows: North by: Site of Laddaru Subbalakshmi South by: Site of Meka Bhagavathi East by: Road West by: Site of Alladi Lakshmi
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
